arts.ttl: Frank Lampard rues two key moments as Coventry City suffer stoppage time defeat at Norwich
arts.sum: Frank Lampard felt for his Coventry City players after they gave up a slender 1-0 lead at Carrow Road where Norwich snatched a stoppage time victory to deny his side the three points. Put to him that it was a horrible way to lose a game of football, Lampard said: “Yeah, and I’m disappointed for the players because they gave everything.

arts.ttl: Paddy's Pointers: Four observations after Norwich's storming Coventry comeback
arts.sum: Pink Un editor Paddy Davitt delivers his Coventry City verdict after the Canaries 2-1 Championship win.

arts.ttl: 'Favourite Norwich game ever' - City fans react to dramatic Coventry comeback
arts.sum: Watch Norwich City fans react to the Canaries' 2-1 Championship win over Coventry City at Carrow Road.

arts.ttl: Transfer news and rumours: Vitor Reis to Brighton, Ben Sheaf to Leeds, Cauley Woodrow to Wrexham
arts.sum: Sports Mole rounds up the latest transfer news and rumours, including Vitor Reis to Brighton & Hove Albion, Ben Sheaf to Leeds United and Cauley Woodrow to Wrexham.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings after stoppage time collapse at Norwich City - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Despite the Canaries forcing Oliver Dovin into two really good early saves, it was the Sky Blues who took the lead when a slick move saw the ball won in midfield and moved across to the left where Jack Rudoni played Jake Bidwell in on the left. Started and finished the brilliant move for the first half goal when he won the ball in midfield, laid it off to Sheaf and then got into the box to side foot home unmarked to give City a superb 24th minute lead.

arts.ttl: Amankwah Forson nets twice in added time to help Norwich stun Coventry
arts.sum: Milan van Ewijk had given the Sky Blues the lead.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard has made four changes to his Coventry City team to face Norwich at Carrow Road
arts.sum: The consensus of opinion in the press room is that the Jamaican will be deployed in midfield alongside Ben Sheaf and in place of Josh Eccles, who drops to the bench, which would leave Milan van Ewijk at right-back and Jake Bidwell at left-back – the latter continuing to be preferred to Jay Dasilva. City: Oliver Dovin; Milan Van Ewijk, Bobby Thomas, Liam Kitching, Jake Bidwell; Joel Latibeaudiere, Ben Sheaf; Brandon Thomas-Asante, Jamie Allen, Jack Rudoni; Norman Bassette.

arts.ttl: MATCHDAY LIVE: Norwich City v Coventry City
arts.sum: Join Connor Southwell from Carrow Road to follow live updates and join the debate as Norwich City welcome Coventry to Norfolk.

arts.ttl: Norwich City v Coventry City live updates and team news from Carrow Road
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. Get the latest Coventry City headlines sent straight to your phone
Norwich City top scorer Borja Sainz is charged with allegedly spitting at an opponent during last month's game against Sunderland.
